description: Disabling IPv6 on systems can lead to unexpected consequences, especially with regard to connectivity and system functionality. Many Microsoft infrastructures now utilize IPv6 extensively, and turning it off could interfere with various network operations and services that rely on it. As highlighted, if IPv6 is disabled, the system may not be affected by certain vulnerabilities stated in specific CVEs; however, operational issues could arise that compromise system performance or stability. System administrators are advised to keep IPv6 enabled as a best practice to ensure smooth and full operation of their environments. Reference documentation points to KB29601, which provides further details about this configuration best practice.
